ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class where all of the navigation of the robot is handled
    Author:
    yp

    • Method Detail

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo(double theta)
        Rotates the robot to an absolute angle theta. It also ensures the robot turns the minimal angle to get to theta.
        Parameters:
        theta - the absolute angle the robot should turn to in degrees

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double distance)
        Converts input distance to the total rotation of each wheel needed to cover that distance.
        Parameters:
        distance -
        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to cover the distance

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double angle)
        Converts input angle to the total rotation of each wheel needed to rotate the robot by that angle.
        Parameters:
        angle -
        Returns:
        the wheel rotations necessary to rotate the robot by the angle

      • distance

        private static double distance(double deltaX,
              double deltaY)
        Calculates the euclidian distance given an X and Y distance, in cm.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - X distance
        deltaY - Y distance
        Returns:
        Euclidean distance

      • moveForwardByTile

        public static void moveForwardByTile(double i)
        moves the robot forward by x many tile lengths this is a blocking method
        Parameters:
        i - number of tile lengths

      • moveForwardOneTileNonBloking

        public static boolean moveForwardOneTileNonBloking()
        move forward until the robot encounters an obstacle or finishes the movement of one tile length
        Returns:
        boolean which returns true if the robot finishes without encountering an obstacle

      • turnLeft

        public static void turnLeft()
        turns the robot 90 degrees left and sleep the color sensor threads

      • turnRight

        public static void turnRight()
        turns the robot 90 degrees right and sleep the color sensor threads

      • findTarget

        public static int[] findTarget(int targetX,
               int targetY)
        returns the nearest available square to shoot from which is N square away form the target
        Parameters:
        targetX - x coordinates of the target square, starting from 0
        targetY - y coordinates of the target square, starting from 0
        Returns:
        the target square coordinates and the angle needed in an int array of size [3]

      • getReadyToShoot

        public static void getReadyToShoot(int targetX,
                   int targetY)
        moves the robot to the optimal square and take aim
        Parameters:
        targetX - target square X coordinate
        targetY - target square Y coordinate

      • stopTheRobot

        public static void stopTheRobot()
        stops the robot in place

      • processNextMove

        public static void processNextMove(int[] move)
        process a move which takes the form of a size 2 array. The robot will either turn right, turn left or go straight, then move by one tile
        Parameters:
        move - a size 2 array representing the move. This can only take the following forms: {1,0}{-1,0}{0,1}{0,-1}
